results.title: Reflections in a golden eye
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Ray Stark and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: An edgy drama based on a novel by Carson McCullers this feature focuses on complicated relationships. The story is set on a Southern American Army Base in 1948 and is a complex web of sexual repression, military discipline and extra-marital affairs. Major Penderton (Marlon Brando) hides his homosexual tendencies behind strict discipline while his frustrated wife (Elizabeth Taylor) has an affair with a Lt. Colonel (Brian Keith). To make things more complicated the Lt. Colonel’s wife is also having an affair with her houseboy. Then there is Private Williams (Robert Foster) who likes naked horse riding. The repressed and obsessive Major Penderton has strong feelings of mixed jealousy when the young Private shows interest in his wife rather than him. This story of bad marriages and military life is both bleak and obsessive. The characters are living in a self imposed prison which they can not escape. This is a tense and compelling drama although criticized for its average screenplay.

results.title: Sally of the sawdust
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on a stage play “Sally of the Sawdust” features the first screen appearance of W.C. Fields and is a silent romantic comedy directed by the great D.W. Griffith. The drama starts in a circus during the Twenties and introduces the story of an orphan Sally (Carol Dempster) and her loveable, juggler, circus performing carer Prof. Eustace P. McGarcle (Fields). Sally is initially unaware that McGargle is not her real father who, through the course of events, decides to reunite her with her grandparents. They make a comedic journey to the town of her grandparents where a wealthy man falls for the circus girl and the drama unfolds. It is a story of mistaken identity, romance and family reunions. The film is known more for being W.C. Fields first screen appearance than one of D.W. Griffith’s greats although it has all the hallmarks of his film genius. It is an entertaining and visually exciting silent melodrama. This version has a music score added. Cast includes Alfred Lunt a theatre actor making a rare screen appearance.

results.title: The Great Houdini
results.creator_credit: Melville Shavelson and American Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: A biographical dramatisation created from fact and fiction about one of America’s most fascinating performers and escape artists, Harry Houdini. “The Great Houdini” is a revealing film that provides an insight into his background, his family, his wife (played by Sally Struthers), and his rise to international fame. The memory of Harry Houdini still lives on today. Stars Paul Michael Glasser as Houdini, Ruth Gordon, Vivian Vance, Adrienne Barbeau, Bill Bixby, Peter Cushing, Nina Foch, Wilfred Hyde-White and Maureen O’Sullivan.

Based on the play by Joe Orton.

results.title: Son of Lassie
results.creator_credit: S. Sylvan Simon, Samuel Marx and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Introduced by Bill Collins, “Son of Lassie” is a sequel to “Lassie come home”, based on some characters from the book “Lassie come home” by Eric Knight. It is set during World War II and tells the story of adventure and loyalty between man and dog - Ken (Peter Lawford) and Laddie, son of everyone’s favourite collie, Lassie. A classic family favourite with a cast including Donald Crisp, June Lockhart, Nigel Bruce.

results.title: Abe Lincoln in Illinois
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell, Max Gordon and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Adapted from the Pulitzer Prize-winning play by American author and playwright, Robert E. Sherwood, this film version captures the essence and fervour of one of America’s most memorable periods in its founding history. It takes a biographical slice of time out of Abraham Lincoln’s (Raymond Massey) life beginning with his early adult years as a woodsman, to his courtships first with Ann Rutledge (Mary Howard) and then with Mary Todd (Ruth Gordon), his eventual wife, through to years of law practice and finally to his election as President and the Declaration of Independence. Cast also includes Gene Lockhart, Howard da Silva and Alan Baxter.

results.title: English without tears
results.creator_credit: Harold French, William Sassoon, Sydney Box, Anatole de Grunwald and Two Cities Films
results.brief_description: Set in Geneva Switzerland during World War II “English without tears” is a gentle and entertaining romantic satire. The multi-plots within the film mainly focus on the small things that matter to people during wartime. An aristocratic family including an eccentric bird fancier (Margaret Rutherford) leaves for Geneva. The faithful butler joins the army and becomes lieutenant. The charming daughters falls for the butler who is successful in his new role. The plot becomes amusing as the story unfolds while the class barriers of peacetime relax and the romantic complications reveal themselves. A charming English studio film. Cast includes Michael Wilding, Margaret Rutherford, Lili Palmer and Penelope Ward.

results.title: The Divorce of lady X
results.creator_credit: Tim Wheelan, Alexander Korda and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This is a delightful and light romantic comedy starring Laurence Olivier and Merle Oberon. A thick fog in London forces those at a fancy dress ball to remain overnight at the hotel where the ball is being held. As there is a room shortage the charming and lovely Leslie Steel (Oberon) is forced to share a room with the irritable and handsome lawyer Evarard Logan (Olivier). The lawyer assumes that the mysterious and yet unnamed character is married. The following day an accusing Lord Mee (Ralph Richardson) talks of his wife spending the night in a man’s room. Smitten and bewildered Everard Logan is forced to think of the consequences believing that he might know the clients of a divorce case that he is working on better than he thought! This easy going yet sophisticated comedy is well performed and enjoyable.
